title: Guys is cs core better or cs(ai/ml) better

comments.body:

This has already been answered in the FAQs. From a future career as well as Masters point of view, core CS is the clear better option. Don't pick specialised degrees unless you know you will be interested in it. 

Read the FAQ for a very detailed post about the same.
Hey is there a helpline number or student helpline desk something because the admissions office doesn't pick up calls and I want someone to present my concern to them.

Your best bet would be to look at the website if you can find any. Not aware of any. 

But no, PES in general is known to be very unreachable. That's why I always recommend visiting them in person if possible. 

You can also try posting your query here and someone can try answering it.

I did make a post and somehow I can't now because some guidelines are not met , I have complained here too. I found another person whose rank got automatically changed on the portal before the ranklist was out. 

I'm not from karanataka that's why I feel maybe a student helpline or support can help in this case

What's your query about? If it's about ranks, then it won't be allowed. 

Regardless, DM me. Let me see if I can help or direct you to someone who can.

Why are u getting downvoted
Everything u said is true
If I have to choose between ai/ml and ece, is ai/ml a better option?
If I have to choose btw ai/ml and ece is ai/ml a better option?
Ohh okayy
First rule: you can't compare between different branches. The better one is always the one you are most interested in.

Because people should choose a branch that they have prior interest in, something they want to pursue and study, something they want to build a career in. **Not one which helps you score a higher GPA**. GPA is only used as a filter, anything above a certain threshold will provide you access to the same opportunities. 

Besides, the logic is flawed since it depends on the difficulty of the question papers being set in that year. If CS-AIML gets harder papers the next year, would OC change their stance on which is the better branch?

No like u told me ai/ml is already a specialized branch.. So for doing mtech cs core is always a better option.. If I don't get cs and my only option is either ai/ml of circuital branches then is taking a specialized branch like ai/ml worth?
If you *really* want any kind of CS branch and want to pursue your Masters in CS too, then CS-AIML would be better than ECE.
Alright thanks .

Bro i was also in same situation i asked everyone they just tell there options at the end you are the one to choose . I decided cse in ec over aiml in rr but still ended up in rr because of my parents so best of luck buddy

Ece and cse(aiml) are very very different.
That depends on ur interests. U can't even compare the two.
Decide btw the two and then choose college.
No like if I don't get cs core, is taking a specialized branch like ai/ml worth

Should I take cse in ec instead of aiml in rr? I'm not sure if I'm ready to specialize and I've heard that cse in ec is the same as cse in rr because of placements teaching and curriculum being the same the mod has also mentioned that there is no bias between campuses and companies won't know which campus you're from it even won't be mentioned on the certificate.

What should I do?

Hods may change, paper setters can change , hell the whole grading system has a change sometimes. So you can never assume who gets the "easier papers" and which branch has moderation.   
Thats why choosing branch based on  the difficulty level of PYQs is wrong.

Don't take ece anywhere as a compromise for cse.
In fact these speciality ones are a good compromise compared to core.
Like i said there is barely a difference between cse and cse(aiml)

I was in the same situation last year , I chose cse core in ec and I don't regret it . I can change by branch to rr aiml even now with the cgpa I'll have . I would recommend cse core but yeah upto you brother . 
Check faqs too
Thank you will keep this in mind!!
